{"id":941607187,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"4 months, 3 weeks","timestamp":1682780500,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"7 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/941607187/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Maximum Number of Fish in a Grid","memory":"42.7 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    int gMax = 0;\n    int lMax = 0;\n    int dx[] = {1, 0, -1, 0};\n    int dy[] = {0, 1, 0, -1};\n    \n    public int findMaxFish(int[][] grid) {\n        \n        int rows = grid.length;\n        int cols = grid[0].length;\n        boolean[][] visited = new boolean[rows][cols];\n        for(int i = 0; i < rows; i++) {\n            for(int j = 0; j < cols; j++) {\n                if(!visited[i][j] && grid[i][j] > 0){\n                    lMax = 0;\n                    dfs(i, j, grid, visited);\n                    gMax = Math.max(gMax, lMax);\n                } \n            }\n        }\n        return gMax;            \n    }\n    \n    public void dfs(int i, int j, int[][] grid, boolean[][] visited) {\n        lMax += grid[i][j];\n        visited[i][j] = true;\n        for(int k = 0; k < 4; k++) {\n            int nextRow = i + dx[k];\n            int nextCol = j + dy[k];\n            if(nextRow >= 0 && nextRow < grid.length && nextCol >= 0 && nextCol < grid[0].length && !visited[nextRow][nextCol] && grid[nextRow][nextCol] > 0) {\n                dfs(nextRow, nextCol, grid, visited);\n            }\n        }\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"maximum-number-of-fish-in-a-grid","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
